Leaflet Maps

Leaflet is designed with simplicity, performance and usability in mind. It works efficiently across all major desktop and mobile platforms. Read the Official Leaflet Documentation for a full list of instructions and other options.

Basic Map

A default map style by Leaflet Maps.

var map = L.map('leaflet1').setView([51.505, -0.09], 7);

L.tileLayer('https://{s}.tile.openstreetmap.org/{z}/{x}/{y}.png', {
  maxZoom: 19,
  attribution: '© OpenStreetMap'
}).addTo(map);



With Popups

Popups are usually used when you want to attach some information to a particular object on a map.

var map2 = L.map('leaflet2').setView([51.505, -0.09], 12);

L.tileLayer('https://{s}.tile.openstreetmap.org/{z}/{x}/{y}.png', {
  maxZoom: 19,
  attribution: '© OpenStreetMap'
}).addTo(map2);

L.marker([51.5, -0.09]).addTo(map2)
.bindPopup("Hello world!
I am a popup.").openPopup();



Markers, Circles & Polygons

Besides tile layers, you can easily add other things to your map, including markers, polylines, polygons, circles, and popups.

var map3 = L.map('leaflet3').setView([51.505, -0.09], 12);

L.tileLayer('https://{s}.tile.openstreetmap.org/{z}/{x}/{y}.png', {
  maxZoom: 19,
  attribution: '© OpenStreetMap'
}).addTo(map3);

L.marker([51.5, -0.09]).addTo(map3);

L.circle([51.508, -0.11], {
  color: 'red',
  fillColor: '#f03',
  fillOpacity: 0.5,
  radius: 500
}).addTo(map3);

L.polygon([
  [51.509, -0.08],
  [51.503, -0.06],
  [51.51, -0.047]
]).addTo(map3);



Basic Map With Popups Markers, Circles & Polygons
